result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Isaac J or Andrew L.
- Defendant shall not be on Victoria Ln in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
